{{Infobox software | name = Anaconda | screenshot = [[File:Fedora 15 Anaconda Installer Screen.png|200px]] | caption = Anaconda's installation screen for [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] 15 | developer = Anaconda Team | latest_release_version = | latest_release_date = | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating_system = [[Linux]] | programming_language = [[Python (programming language)|Python]] and [[C (programming language)|C]] | genre = [[Installer]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] ([[Free software]]) | website = [http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Anaconda fedoraproject.org/wiki/Anaconda] }} '''Anaconda''' is the installer for [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]] and [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]].
[[Anaconda]]s are [[lizard]]-eating snakes (similar to [[Pythonidae|pythons]]), and the [[Caldera OpenLinux|Caldera]] installation program was called âLizardâ, hence the name.
== Functionality == Anaconda offers a text-mode and GUI mode, so users can install on a wide range of systems. It is designed to be easily portable and supports a wide range of hardware platforms ([[IA-32]], [[Itanium]], [[DEC Alpha]], [[IBM ESA/390]], [[PowerPC]]). It supports installing from local storage devices like CD-ROM drives and harddisks as well as from network resources via [[File Transfer Protocol|FTP]], [[File Transfer Protocol|HTTP]], or [[Network File System (protocol)|NFS]]. Installations can be automated with the use of a [[Kickstart (Linux)|kickstart]] file, that automatically configures the installation, allowing users to run it with minimal supervision.
== Technology == It is mainly written in [[Python (programming language)|Python]] with some modules written in [[C (programming language)|C]]. It has a graphical frontend that is based on [[PyGTK]] and designed with the [[Glade Interface Designer]] as well as a text frontend using [[Newt (programming library)|newt]].
== Availability and usage == It is available as [[Free software]] under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]] (GPL).
Anaconda installer is used by [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux|RHEL]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] and a number of other projects.<ref>http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Anaconda/Distros</ref>
